articles.headline: Consumer Bureau Proposes New Mortgage Disclosure Rules
articles.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Monday proposed rules to improve fairness and clarity in residential lending that would arm home buyers with a simple accounting of how much their loan will likely cost them.
articles.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Monday proposed rules to improve fairness and clarity in residential lending that would arm home buyers with a simple accounting of how much their loan will likely cost them.
articles.lead_paragraph: As part of a continuing overhaul of the home mortgage market, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Monday issued proposed rules to bolster fairness and clarity in residential lending, including requiring a good-faith estimate of costs for homebuyers.

articles.headline: As They Lose Traffic, Once Bustling Airports Have Space to Rent
articles.snippet: Airports in St. Louis, Pittsburgh, Cincinnati and other secondary cities are having to address vacant terminals and hangars as they lose business to bigger destinations.
articles.abstract: Airports in St. Louis, Pittsburgh, Cincinnati and other secondary cities are having to address vacant terminals and hangars as they lose business to bigger destinations.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fate of Lambert-St. Louis International Airport may be a portent for other airports serving smaller cities around the United States.

articles.headline: Obama Trails Romney Again in Battle for Campaign Cash
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney and the Republican National Committee outraised President Obama’s money machine for the second month in a row. Democratic-aligned “super PACs” are also trailing their G.O.P. counterparts.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney and the Republican National Committee outraised President Obama’s money machine for the second month in a row. Democratic-aligned “super PACs” are also trailing their G.O.P. counterparts.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the battle for political cash, President Obama is finding himself in an unaccustomed place during the final months of the 2012 campaign: he is losing.

articles.headline: Tech and Media Elite Are Likely to Debate Piracy
articles.snippet: Top technology and entertainment executives will gather in Sun Valley, Idaho, on Tuesday, the first time they have done so since the debate over two controversial antipiracy bills.
articles.abstract: Top technology and entertainment executives will gather in Sun Valley, Idaho, on Tuesday, the first time they have done so since the debate over two controversial antipiracy bills.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s not often moguls admit they made a mistake.

articles.headline: A Reality Series Finds Silicon Valley Cringing
articles.snippet: The new Bravo reality series “Silicon Valley” puts a spotlight, and not necessarily a flattering one, on the technology industry.
articles.abstract: The new Bravo reality series “Silicon Valley” puts a spotlight, and not necessarily a flattering one, on the technology industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Silicon Valley is finally getting the treatment once reserved for rowdy housewives and excitable chefs: its own Bravo reality series. But the tech world is not quite ready for its close-up.
